info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 9:43AM CDT until August 02 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Christian County in central Illinois... Southwestern Logan County in central Illinois... Western Macon County in central Illinois... Southeastern Mason County in central Illinois... Central Menard County in central Illinois... Sangamon County in central Illinois... * Until 1245 PM CDT. * At 943 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Springfield, Chatham, Sherman, Rochester, Riverton, Petersburg, Athens, Mount Pulaski, Williamsville, New Berlin, Edinburg, Stonington, Greenview, Loami, Mechanicsburg, Elkhart, Middletown, Cornland, Jerome and Southern View. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
